p: Cineol or Eucalyptol is also known as cajeputol, is a terpene oxide that found in some plant essential oil [ 73] particularly Achillea biebersteinii Afan, Artemisia capillaris, Croton zehntneri, Hyptis crenata and Rosmarinus officinalis essential oils. It is frequently used as an aromatic agent for food products and it is used by the pharmaceutical industry in the production of the drugs. Cineol has been used as a growth inhibitor and to treat the symptoms of respiratory tract diseases [ 72]. Indeed, there are several studies have shown that this compound has an anti-inflammatory and analgesic effects [ 73]. In addition, it has shown an inhibitory activity in vivo and in vitro on the production of inflammatory mediators such as cytokines, leukotrienes and prostaglandins from human blood monocytes stimulated by lipopolysaccharides [ 74].
